holidays.name: Stay At Home Because You're Well Day
holidays.description: A day encouraging those who feel good to stay home and avoid spreading illness—kind of like reverse peer pressure!
holidays.origin: Invented as a tongue-in-cheek reminder to prevent the spread of germs by staying home if you’re well rather than risking infecting others.
holidays.funFact: This day flips the usual ‘push through illness’ mindset on its head—celebrating wellness by staying cozy indoors!

holidays.name: Computer Security Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to raising awareness about computer security and encouraging safe online habits to protect our digital lives.
holidays.origin: Started in 1988 after the Morris Worm incident to remind people about the importance of cybersecurity.
holidays.funFact: This day is a great excuse to update your passwords, turn on two-factor authentication, and maybe pretend you understand all those encryption terms!

holidays.name: Day of the Ninja
holidays.description: A playful day to celebrate ninjas and ninja culture, encouraging people to dress like stealthy warriors and embrace their inner ninja.
holidays.origin: Originated online in 2003 by a group of ninja enthusiasts to have fun showcasing ninja skills and pop culture.
holidays.funFact: Participants often attempt to 'ninja vanish' by sneaking away unnoticed—so watch behind your back! Ultimate ninja moves approved.

holidays.name: National Mason Jar Day
holidays.description: A quirky tribute to the humble mason jar, celebrating its versatility from canning food to serving cocktails and DIY crafts.
holidays.origin: Began as a social media-driven celebration honoring this iconic kitchen staple.
holidays.funFact: Mason jars were introduced in 1858 and revolutionized food preservation—plus they double as perfect rustic drinkware!
